definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
comic crosstalk/formalized comic dialogue between two stand-up comics: funny man 逗哏[dou4 gen2] and straight man 捧哏[peng3 gen2]

sentences.english: Have you ever seen in a group of people in the theatre to an audience that crosstalk?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾看到德雲社一羣人在劇場裏給一位觀衆說相聲？

sentences.english: In the comic dialogue, two performers revealed the joke suddenly, which made the audience convulse with laughter.
sentences.chinese: 相聲演員不時抖包袱，令現場觀衆捧腹大笑。

sentences.english: She is a famous comedienne here.
sentences.chinese: 她是這裏有名的單口相聲家。

sentences.english: Almost every Chinese likes to listen to cross talks.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每一箇中國人都愛聽相聲。

sentences.english: In this thesis relevance theory is used to analyze the humor in Chinese cross talk .
sentences.chinese: 在本論文中，關聯理論被用來分析中國相聲中的幽默。

sentences.english: The crosstalk (comic dialogue) is the main form of public entertainment in China.
sentences.chinese: 相聲小品是我國大衆娛樂的主要形式。

sentences.english: The cross-talk, I think, was both interesting and instructive.
sentences.chinese: 相聲，我覺得，既有趣又能教育人。

sentences.english: I learned crosstalk from Mr. Zhou Deshan for three years.
sentences.chinese: 我學到的相聲，從周先生山爲三年。

sentences.english: Typical for China is the crosstalk show.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，典型的喜劇形式是相聲表演。

sentences.english: Crosstalk comedian Guo Degang makes a cameo appearance in the movie.
sentences.chinese: 相聲演員郭德綱也在片中客串了一個片段。

sentences.english: Throughout cross talk’s history, performers have come from humble backgrounds.
sentences.chinese: 在整個相聲的發展歷史當中，表演者多數出身卑微。

sentences.english: At the get-together, several boys in our class performed a group crosstalk.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會上，我們班的幾個男生說了一段羣口相聲。

sentences.english: Stand-up comedy is very popular with the public.
sentences.chinese: 對口相聲是深受人們喜愛的表演形式。

sentences.english: He started to perform on stage since1960 and was deeply loved by Chinese and foreign audience.
sentences.chinese: 1960年開始登臺表演相聲，深受中外觀衆的喜愛。

sentences.english: Their humorous crosstalk was a great complement to the New Year Celebration.
sentences.chinese: 他們的幽默的相聲爲新年慶典增添了不少趣味。

definition: to read aloud with expression/to recite/to declaim
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
type of opera from Taiwan and Fujian
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
speaking and singing, as in various forms of storytelling such as 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2] and 相聲|相声[xiang4 sheng5]/(music) rapping
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
unable to make sense of what one is hearing
